result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 10-30-2015 11:00 am

1:02 Defendant Christopher J Howard in court with attorney Nicholas Abts.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Abts does not formerly have an agreement but agrees to the Speedy Trial Demand.  Atty Abts would like sometime to talk with his client today and will come back and let the court know their decision.  1:22 Court reconvenes and Atty Abts asks court for a trial date.  1:26 Court recesses to allow counsel time to see if they could try the case tomorrow.  1:45 Court reconvenes.  All parties are prepared to proceed tomorrow with trial.  Atty Abts would plead if the court would entertain a bond modification.  Court will take the plea today.  Atty Abts asks that the court modify bond to a signature bond with the same conditions.  State does not object.  Court finds that the bond in 15CM517 is a signature bond.  Matter is set for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Christopher J Howard in court with attorney Richard E. Bender.  Defendant Christopher J Howard in custody.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Lambert states that the defendant does not wish to make a plea today and does not wish to continue with the speedy trial motion.  Court addresses when the 60 days should start and Atty. Bender argues.  Court will set jury trial dates  Atty. Bender requests to withdraw.  Court orders that Atty. Bender contact the public defenders office and have a new attorney appointed before he be allowed to withdraw.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing at 10-08-2015 11:00 am
(Defendant)
Cover Letter from Atty. Richard E. Bender, dated Sept. 8, 2015.
